isis.stitle: TSI 04-12-23RA - Coolant Sealant Conditioner To Eliminate Engine Front Cover Leaks

subjectgroup.subject: Coolant Sealant Conditioner To Eliminate Engine Front Cover Leaks

geninfo.para: A campaign identification label and use instructions were added to this TSI. This TSI applies to all International® I6 electronic injection controlled engines with serial number range 1134351 through 1999999 (excluding 2000000 serial number series). Engines equipped with an Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) valve, a 2004 MY emission label, and a serial number that starts with 2000000 and above are excluded from use of this service kit. This procedure may be used for any International® I6 engine developing front cover leaks. Applicable diesel engines have two front cover gaskets made of silicone material. The two gaskets are allowing coolant to leak externally because they are not compatible with International® Extended Life Coolant (ELC).
To reduce down time, International is introducing a coolant sealant conditioner kit to service engines leaking from front covers.
The kit contains a specified number of tablets and charted instructions which cover all International® DT 466, DT 530, HT 530, 530E, and 530E Green Diesel Technology® diesel engines.
1850155C92 service kit [20 tablets plus an additional six tablet kit (the 6 tablet kit should be used only for large capacity cooling systems such as bus)]
Should an applicable series engine develop a leak in one or both front cover gaskets, add the specified number of tablets. This sealant conditioner is designed as a lasting repair.
Do not apply the coolant sealant conditioner more than one time.

Place a Campaign Identification Label CTS-1075 C (comes in a pack of 25) over the existing Texaco/Shell ELC decal (located on the surge tank). Mark the label "CSC added and the addition date" to prevent accidental reapplication of the sealant conditioner. See Figure.

note.para: Addition of sealant conditioner as part of this TSI and kit instruction does not violate the note in the "Cleaning the Cooling System" subsection of Section 6 of the Engine Operation and Maintenance Manual and will not invalidate the warranty.
